content: stitch evenly sew every double_crochet blo together starting at one end and down the side to next corner cut and tie off whip stitch along here 11 now to extend the back side of cardigan making it a bit wider we are going to work a few more row to one side of the hexagon *you can choose to skip this part if you want the cardigan to have a more snug/form fitting fit* if when you finish you feel you need to make it wider than that i suggest adding more repeats until you reach desired width keep in mind whatever you add on one hexagon you need to add to the other so for example if you extend the back and add 2 inches on one hexagon you need to add 2 inches to other making the total width added 4 inches i suggest writing down any changes made once finished sewing turn right side out and continue with the right side instructions with one hexagon when you reach this point with the second hexagon continue with the left side instructions right side with rs facing you and starting at the 2nd stitch marker this would be the bottom of the cardigan attach yarn to first double_crochet you should be working on the side of the hexagon with the unworked edge on your right row1 with accent color attach yarn to first double_crochet ch3 skip next double_crochet single_crochet in between double_crochet ch2 *skip 3 double_crochet single_crochet in between double_crochet ch2* across to the first corner single_crochet in corner cut and tie off row2 with main color attach yarn to first ch2 space from previous row ch3 2 double_crochet in same *3 double_crochet in next ch2 space* across to last ch2 space 2 double_crochet in last ch2 space cut and tie off row 3 with accent color attach yarn to first double_crochet ch3 skip next double_crochet single_crochet in between double_crochet ch2 *skip 3 double_crochet single_crochet in between double_crochet ch2* across to last space between double_crochet single_crochet in last space skip next double_crochet single_crochet in last double_crochet cut and tie off row4 with main color attach yarn to first ch2 space from previous row ch3 2 double_crochet in same *3 double_crochet in next ch2 space* across to last ch2 space 2 double_crochet between last 2 single_crochet cut and tie off 12 *update* left side with the left side we are going to do exactly what we did with the right side just opposite with ws facing you and starting with the other stitch marker this would be the top where you neck would be attatch yarn to first double_crochet repeat row 1 - 4 from right side instructions after row 1 13 you should end up with something like this 2 pieces with just the back part extended 14 assembly almost there now we are going to join both hexagons together forming the main body of your cardigan so exciting take both hexagons and turn them inside out once more
